data: [color=#B00000]MARIO[/color] will fall through [color=#A8D0D0]GLASS BLOCKS[/color], however, they are semi-solids for all other objects!
The [color=#B00000]BARRIER BLOCK[/color] is an invisible solid block, it can only be seen in the editor.
The [color=#F80080]ARROW[/color] can be customized to point at any direction.
en
This is the entrance you can link an exit to warp to.
ex
When the player enters this warp, it will teleport them to an entrance that shares this exit's ID.
ec
When the player loses a life, they will respawn at the entrance this checkpoint is set to.
o1

[color=#F8D820]COINS[/color] are one of the most fundamental objects to include in a Mario level! Coins usually come in small groups, and can also be used to indicate a path.
[color=#D8A038]SHIFT: [/color] Change coin mode (still/left/right/outlined)
o3

Shift-click on a placed Item Block to set its item!
[color=#A8D0D0]CTRL: [/color] Change block mode
[color=#B00000]PROGRESSIVE (Mushroom):[/color] Give a mushroom when Mario's small, otherwise spawn the set power-up.
[color=#F8D820]STARCHAIN (Star):[/color] Give a Star while Mario still has Starman power-ups, otherwise spawn the set power-up.
o8

Springboards can bounce objects upwards or sideways. Press [color=#A8D0D0]CTRL[/color] to swap springboards.
[color=#B00000]RED[/color] springs can not be picked up, and [color=#F8D820]YELLOW[/color] springs do not have any gravity.
o9

P-SWITCHES will transform [color=#F8D820]COINS[/color] into [color=#D8A038]BRICK BLOCKS[/color] and vice versa. They also reveal P-DOORS, P-BLOCKS and P-COINS.[color=#A8D0D0]

CTRL:[/color] Toggle infinite usage on/off

PARACHUTES are capable of carrying many sprites. Simply place one on top of an enemy/object!

[color=#A8D0D0]CTRL: [/color] Change parachute type

[color=#8888F8]BLUE: [/color] Default parachute[color=#F88000]
RED: [/color] Chasing parachute[color=#E0E0E0]
GHOST: [/color] Chasing, goes through walls

[color=#F88000]Toad[/color] is an NPC that can give the player extra information such as tips, storyline or jokes... whatever you want Him to say! There are colored variants, as well as a [color=#FF006A]TOADETTE[/color] and [color=#FDDB5F]TOADSWORTH[/color] sprite. He is also capable of pressing [color=#7E7EF7]P-SWITCHES[/COLOR].
The [color=#F80080]TRIANGULAR BLOCK[/color] allows the player to walk on walls and ceilings! When with [color=#00F800]Yoshi[/color], it will bounce them super high.
The SKULL RAFT will move over liquids once activated. [color=#70B0D0]BLUE[/COLOR] ones are slower, [color=#FF0000]RED[/color] ones are very fast.

The [color=#4040D8]BLUE POW[/color] has a large range, but is weaker than the shorter-ranged [color=#8C0000]RED POW[/color], that can activate other blocks, including other POWs for chain reactions!

[color=#A8D0D0]CTRL: [/color] Toggle Blue/Red POW

The [color=#D2F3FF]ICE BLOCK[/color] variant is the same as the [color=#52529F]GRAB BLOCK[/color], but can't be spinjumped on.
[color=#A8D0D0]CTRL: [/color] Toggle grab/ice-block
[color=#D8A038]PRESENTS[/color] can contain many items and can be opened with a SPINJUMP or throwing it against a wall.

DONUT BLOCKS fall shortly after Mario stands on them for too long.

[color=#A8D0D0]CTRL: [/color] Change Donut Block type

[color=#F8D820]YELLOW: [/color] Default fall timer, respawns[color=#C89858]
WOODEN: [/color] Default fall timer, no respawn
[color=#979797]STONE: [/color] Falls instantly, no respawn

The [color=#BD0000]RED COIN RING[/color] activates all [color=#BD0000]RED COINS[/color] when triggered, typically 8, but there can be as many [color=#BD0000]RED COINS[/color] as you want. When they're all collected, it will reward you the [color=#D8A038]POWER-UP[/color]!

The [color=#C5751E]BROWN P-SWITCH[/color] transforms [color=#C5751E]BROWN BLOCKS[/color] into [color=#C5751E]BROWN COINS[/color] and vice versa.


[color=#A8D0D0]CTRL:[/color] Toggle infinite usage on/off
SWITCH PALACE SWITCHES will transform same colored ○ blocks to ◙. Switch Palace states are a rare exception to the map-reset rule.
BUBBLES can contain enemies and objects. To get one inside, place a BUBBLE in the opposite layer of the sprite, or right next to it.
[color=#C0C0C0]GRAY BLOCKS[/color] simply defeat or hit an enemy/object on top of it. This is an useful block for contraptions!
The AXE will destroy Bowser's Bridges once hit.
[color=#B80050]BOSS GATES[/color] are invisible at first, but activate when a boss fight starts. They are destroyed when all active bosses are defeated.
[color=#FF0000]BADDIE[/color] [color=#007848]BOXES[/color] will spawn almost any object that is put on top of it. You can customize how much objects it spawns, the delay between spawn, and lots more!
This block is only solid for Mario.
[color=#F8D000]DRAGON COINS[/color] are a collectable and can be a good way to make your level more fun. You can set how many need to be collected for the fanfare in the level settings.
